paper_abstract: By some basic transforms and invariant theory, we give two results: 1) an algorithm, which can be used to judge if two Boolean functions are affinely equivalent and to obtain the equivalence relationship if they are equivalent. This is useful in studying Boolean functions and in engineering. For example, we classify all 8-variable homogeneous bent functions of degree 3 into two classes; 2) Reed-Muller codes R(4,6)/R(1,6), R(3,7)/R(1,7) are classified efficiently.
paper_title: Analysis of affinely equivalent Boolean functions
